ratings.comment: Best math teacher I have ever had. Calc 2 is a hard class. Justin was always prepared for lectures and has some of the neatest handwriting I have ever seen. He cares about his students and will always answer questions. Exams were tough but fair. Overall, great professor.

You can really tell Prof. Sukiennik cares about his students. He is extremely friendly, and sometimes makes fun of how absurd math problems can be. All math sections have almost all your grade being exams so I cannot blame him for being so test heavy. All sections got the same exam, but at the end he shifted the grade scale by 2.5%! Beast professor

Just took my calc final and I can say that prof Sukiennik did a great job of teaching to what was going to be on the test. Our lectures were three times a week at 8:50 am but he is an amazing lecturer who you can tell is passionate about math. A huge plus is that he posts his lecture notes, which could not be more organized and easy to follow.

Professor Sukiennik is a wiz of a professor. He is very knowledgeable regarding anything math related and is an awesome person to talk to outside of class as well! Definitely gonna miss him here at UW-Madison.

As far as math professors he's probably one of the best lecturers in the department. But I will say partial credit on the exams was very sparse (maybe true of all the math 222 sections?). I accidentally wrote 2 instead of 1/2 at the beginning of a problem and got 90% of the points off for that portion even though my strategies were correct

Best Calc professor I have had. Lectures are so organized and easy to follow. Lecture notes are also posted on Canvas usually the next day. Super approachable with questions and eager to help students. Midterms are difficult but straightforward. If taking Calc 2, definitely this professor.

He has really organized notes which make it easier to follow and understand. He can be kind of a slow, monotone talker which makes lectures feel a bit more dragged on. Gives pretty good review material for the tests which really aren't too bad if you review and study some concepts. I would still take him again because I did well in his class.

Prof. Sukiennik is the best math teacher I've ever had. He's passionate about the subjects and interjects interesting math history, is organized and a fantastic lecturer, and explains topics very well. His notes are beautiful, and he walks around the lecture hall to help students. He made me interested in the dreary subject matter of Calculus II.

Amazing Professor! Dude's notes are definitely the best part he comes and projects them and they are extremely organized and laid out and posted after class. The only flaw the lectures time is early. Other than that he has been one of the best professors. someone else mentioned the test being hard but all classes have the same test for 222 so idk

Calc 2 is hard. Justin makes great notes and is easily accessible outside of class. The exams have been average difficulty so far, but exam questions are up to all the calc profs, not just Justin. He's super nice and approachable and wants his students to learn. Wanted to record lectures, but was given a room without a camera. I'd take him again
His exams were way harder than the previous years' exams and partial credit was pretty stringent.

Math has always been my hardest subject in school but Prof Sukiennek is the first math teacher I've had successfully teach me. His lectures were super organized and had great notes that everyone could follow. He's the head of the Pre-Calc department and really provides us with many resources we can use to succeed. Would take again he's a great guy!

I honestly think he is a great professor. The notes that this professor gives you are the best. My only critique is the the class can be quiz and test heavy. If you are a bad test taker, you will need to study a lot. Otherwise was a really good professor.

Most people hate math classes and blame the professor only because they are not good at math and won't take the time to actually learn the material. For Math 114, if you go to class and stay caught up with the material you will be more than fine. Justin was a good professor in my opinion, he always did a lot of examples in class and was empathetic.

Justin is a solid math professor, he teaches by example and spend most of the lectures doing different types of problems. He is a really nice guy and flexible when something comes up. Discussions were optional due to COVID. Overall he was a really nice guy and a decent class.

This professor is so incredible, he made me consider majoring in math, and this is coming from someone who used to hate math. He explains the material really well and tries to make sure everyone knows what's going on.

Honestly my favorite math teacher ever. If I could have him for all of my math classes I would. His lecture notes are very clear with definitions, diagrams, and lots of useful examples. The quizzes and exams are fairly easy if you pay attention in class and practice with the worksheets given in discussions. Very organized too!

Justin is honestly so great. I highly recommend! His lectures are so organized, notes have plenty of examples that actually relate to the homework problems, and his notes are so aesthetic and easy to follow. His exams are fair and include lots of problems similar to exam reviews he posts. Lowest quiz and homework scores are dropped too. Very fair

Math 114. Justin is easy to understand, he covers textbook material, available for help during office hours. AMAZING notes (color, structure and penmanship). Exams are fairly easy if you complete (and understand) homework, reviews, and disc. worksheets. Loved this class! He makes you like math.

I love Justin's lectures. They are so well organized and so easy to understand. You definitely need to participate in class and do your work to get a passing grade but the homework load isn't too bad (1 homework assignment/week and 1 five-question knowledge check/week) Absolutely recommend this class.
tough grader

If you can take someone else, then you better do. His tests are extremely heavy and do not quite reflect what he teaches during the lecture. Plus, he's got an attitude when you ask him a question. Avoid him!

Tough grader and test heavy. There was no curve in the course and he barely gives any partial credits on the test. Lectures are very monotone and kind of boring. No inspiration throughout the course. Find someone better
Very nice supportive inspiring Professor. Organized clean and beautiful notes. Reasonable grader. Always ready and happy to help his students. He loves math and he hopes his students will.

The way he teaches math is not helpful. The exams are very hard with about 2 hours. In other words, he expects you to know every single thing on the exam. He does not know how to motivate students to learn math. Unfortunately, the office hours are not helpful at all since he only talks without writing anything. Tough grader

he cannot teach. had him online and his lectures were decent but he speaks in a very monotone voice. like where is the energy? exams and quizzes are hard. he teaches things with very confusing methods. had to watch youtube videos to learn. if you do not have background knowledge of algebra would not recommend it

He is very conservative about his teaching style. It doesn't matter you understand the topic or not, it seems that he only cares about his teaching. If had a chance, I would definitely take another math professor at the department. He cares little about his students. Find better people in the department.
Do not take him at all. I took math 541 with him and I regret. His exams are super hard to pass. He barely does any examples in the class but puts very hard questions to fail you. Avoid him

He is an average professor. I did very well in this class by doing the problems from textbook. His teaching style is very boring and he has zero motivation for his students. Plus, he sometimes has an attitude when asking a question. I felt that he does not like to be bothered. His exams are very tough. If you have other professor, do not take him.

Make sure you note ALL examples he gives in the class. The exam is pretty tough but pretty similar to the past exam. So, doing past exams will prepare you well for this class. Homework is tough sometimes, but it is interesting and doable if you give it enough time.

Lectures are long, but very worth attending. He puts a lot of effort into making sure lecture notes are clear, and he gives a ton of useful examples in lecture. Homeworks can be long, but are definitely doable. If you go to every lecture and take detailed notes (including examples), you'll pass. Paper notes can be referenced on exams.
Beware of this professor. Very uncaring and shows no interest in student progress. I will never take him for higher math. No useful at all

Justin is the best math professor, I have ever had. His lectures are very neat and organized, and he provides many example questions; often on his exams. Exams are very straightforward and if you do the homework and watch the lectures, you will get a good grade. TRUST ME, he genuinely cares about his students, just make the effort to talk to him.

His lectures were super easy to understand and very clear (he has some of the best penmanship I've seen from a professor). There is mandatory discussion where you work on worksheets with other students which was helpful. The tests were fair and so was the homework. It was one of the better classes I had online.

This class was fairly homework heavy, assignments would be up to 30 questions while the quizzes would only consist of 6. Easy, basic algebra class. Lecture were nice and easy to understand. The short lectures were nice refreshers if thats all you needed. Fairly easy class, I just didnt do many assignments.

I am not great at math, however, when I do take a math course I put as much effort as possible to understand the course material and seek help constantly. I ended up crying during the final because none of the information given on the review was on the exam. Lectures are not explained very well and exam/quiz material is not communicated well.

He was nice, but we were graded almost entirely on exams. The communication also wasn't great, because at one point over 10% of my class thought we could use a calculator on an exam and we were penalized. He was relatively prompt at responding to questions and emails, but overall I thought this class was stressful for no reason.

He was nice and answered questions and emails promptly, but the grade was dependent on exam scores entirely. The things we went over in the discussion never coincided with the content of the exams. There was also a huge miscommunication on one of the exams, where over 10% of the class thought we could use a calculator so communication wasn't great

Do not take this professors course. He does not care even the slightest about his students. His lectures are unbelievably boring. He suggests doing about a million example problems before quizzes and tests and then none are even close to the exam questions. Only good part was I had an amazing TA who was willing to help.

he cannot teach. had him online and his lectures were decent but he speaks in a very monotone voice. like where is the energy? exams and quizzes are hard. he teaches things with very confusing methods. had to watch youtube videos to learn. if you do not have background knowledge of algebra would not recommend it.
Explains relatively clearly, just be sure to watch the pre lecture and lecture videos every week. Helpful in explaining outside of class as well.
cares very little about your success and has a very monotoned voice while lecturing. doesn't always give examples, just assumed you knew the information prior to the class.
Doesnt really care

He is one of the best professor I have ever met in UW-Madison. He gives very clear lecture and cares about his students. The daily materials are hard but exams are not so hard. As long as you study hard for it, you will get an A. For those giving him low ratings, I would say you are not for math. But he is the right man for math.

Justin is a wonderful professor. He is extremely encouraging and really considers how his students feel about the math. For those taking Math 112, I will say it seems intimidating or even pointless to talk to him at first but do strike up a conversation because he tells great stories! He makes himself available to his students which is not common.

His lectures are organized (and colorful!) and do not go at too fast of a pace. I will admit homeworks were difficult, but he helps you through them if you attend his office hours. And though the homework is relatively difficult, the exams are much easier. You can tell how passionate he is about teaching by how excited he gets in class sometimes

He is about an average lecturer, nothing interesting, but it covers the material. However, I felt very disrespected when I spoke to him. He would cut me off in the middle of asking a question or would tell me not to bother him and talk to my TA. He's an okay lecturer but has a very disrespectful attitude.

Professor Sukiennik was one of my least favorite professors at UW-Madison. Not only were his lectures boring, but he genuinely did NOT care about his students. I emailed him to ask for help on several occasions and he responded with "ask you TA" (my TA was clueless & very little help). I have more complaints, just not even characters in this text.

Justin is simply the best linear algebra professor I have ever had. I honestly cannot understand the negative ratings he receives, it almost seems like they refer to someone else! He is very committed and truly cares about his students. He also seems very friendly and a nice person! I wish he would teach linear algebra II.
There is no curve and this class is so poorly taught. The only reason I did not fail is from prior knowledge of algebra.

Great prof for linear algebra! Clearly very knowledgable about the subject and super helpful and understanding in office hours. I would take another course by Justin in a heartbeat, I really enjoyed how much he cares about the material and teaching!

Justin doesn't teach 112, there's like 5 TA's who do, but he does upload weekly pre-lecture videos that are so helpful for what you're learning. I'm not good at math, but if you put in the work, you will do good in this class. All of the TA's are willing to help and give you all the materials to succeed. 4 exams, 3 quizzes, and weekly online hw.

Had him as my linear algebra professor. Probably one of the best professors I've ever met so far based on his passion for our material and the way he constructed the class. It's a hard class. I can tell cuz it's 3 am and I'm still cramming through notes for the final. Justin is a good teacher, but maybe I'm not that good a student after all.

Having Justin as my Linear Algebra professor made everything easier! It is a HARD class and I spent lots of time doing homework problems. But he has the most amazing lectures I've ever had in Math department, good handwriting, slow and clear instructions. Take his linear algebra if you can and you won't regret!

This man is one of the worst. Absolutely horrible at lecturing on relatively basic math. Can't make eye contact, doesn't answer questions, and is one of the most condescending people I've ever had the displeasure of learning from. Avoid this man at all costs! His corny pre-lecture videos and useless lectures will confuse you more than help you!

This professor is a model of everything wrong in teaching. He can't teach, has so much homework it takes 2+ hours a day if you want to do well. The TA's are trying there best but they often didn't know either. Tests were incredibly hard and he does not care about students. The only way of doing ok is doing everything yourself with no help at all.

I took calculus in high school, so I expected to do fine since it is supposed to be simple algebra. The lectures discussed easy problems, while the tests consisted of extremely difficult examples we went over once or not at all. The TAs weren't helpful and are told not to go over example problems in discussion. Also, there is no curve.

This class is very disorganized. The pre lecture videos, actual lectures, and discussion worksheets do not correlate whatsoever. It is very confusing to know what to study for tests. The homework is usually about 100 questions each week. That being said, show up to every discussion and do the homework to help boost your grade. Don't take this class

Worst prof ever. My TA even told me he couldn't care less about undergrads. Class is horrible and the material is really out of order and unorganized. His lectures are great but the information is so simplified compared to what is on the test. Eventually just skipped lecture to do the 100 question HW assignments instead. Avoid this man.

He is the worst. Solves easy problems in the lectures and pre-lecture videos and gives super hard exam problems. Discussion worksheets are super hard, and he discourages the TAs from solving the worksheets on the document camera. He made the final exam the hardest and I think I will go two letter grades down. I feel bad for TAs working for him.

He reads straight from the screen instead of explaining. No emotion when teaching and doesn't make eye contact with the class ever. We asked him what to study for the final and he said "Get sleep and be healthy." Bad teacher.

Easily the worst professor I have ever had. He is incredibly rude and disrespectful to students and TA's. Also, horrendous at communicating. I had an infection and contagious strep, sent him a doctor's note and he said it did not count as an excuse and made me come to the exam. This man should not be a professor. He's an embarrassment to the school

Justin lacks care for his students. Good luck getting through an early morning lecture without slamming your head into a wall. The guy does not teach and leaves it to the TA's, which is the wrong way of going about it. Overall, awful.

Don't expect to be able to talk to him at all. It is pretty obvious he does not care how his students do in the class. Hopefully you get a good TA because that is who will be asking all of your questions to. Make sure to do the pre-lecture checks especially if you're the type to want to skip lecture often.

The homework does not correlate with the lectures. I missed most of the lectures and still passed the class with an A. Overall a very careless teacher. He fails to teach the material, and instead, he just solves the problems rather than explaining.

Do not take this class. The lectures do not help at all, he knows what he's talking about but is not a good teacher. The material on the exams and quizzes do not correlate with what we learn, and theres new material that we haven't learned.

the lectures don't help. he does an ok job at explaining what he's writing but that doesn't matter because the exams and quizzes don't correlate on terms of level of difficulty. TA's are great but they can't help you with every little question. if you have a good background on algebra then you'll be fine, but the rest of us are struggling.

Go to all the discussions so you can get a 100 in attendance because the exams can be lowkey hard!! the prof is very awkward and the TAs are terrible for this class, at least mine is. he has trouble explaining nearly every question we ask. i go to tutoring twice a week and i am still struggling. but do the hw and attend class for a grade boost.
He doesnt explain the math he does in lecture. He completes the problems, but doesnt really explain how he got that answer.

This professor seems to not care about what he teaches. For example, he announced on the first day of class during the lecture that we should not ask him questions, we should ask the TA's. He also does not explain things thoroughly. I would find myself looking to Khan Acadamy to learn. He knows what he is talking about, just not how to teach it.
